decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (  ) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 3 - The glass entrance doors and shop windows hereby approved shall be clearly defined with visual manifestations on the glass at two levels: between 850mm to 1000mm and 1400mm to 1600mm above ground level. The manifestations shall be fixed to, painted on or etched into the glass in the form of a continuous or broken (by no more than 20 mm) horizontal band 50 mm high, or a series of signs or logos at least 150mm high spaced no further than 300 mm apart.  The manifestations shall visually contrast with their surroundings when viewed from both inside and outside the building in all lighting conditions.

The doorway shall have a threshold that is level with the adjoining footway and the internal floor, or shall be designed to have a gradient between the two not exceeding 1:12 that does not impede the passage of a wheelchair, or shall otherwise be modified in accordance with a scheme to enhance disabled persons' access in accordance with details that shall have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority and carried out before the development is completed.
description: Installation of a new shopfront including alterations to the windows and signage with an awning
